area_name: Trad Wall AKA Green River Buttress

content.description: R facing corner that is mostly tight hands and off-fingers. A few hand pods eases the difficulties.

A great route with a weird start and finish. The start is soft and a little scary as you yard on a huge flake. A left facing corner with mostly 1s turns into a right facing corner with mostly 1s until it turns to fingers with some helpful features. Get a no-hands rest and enjoy the thoughtful poddy fingers splitter. It seams out about a body length from the chains, requiring some delicate face moves with gear at your feet and 40 meters of rope tugging at your belay loop.

An 80m rope will not get you down! Luckily we had an extra rope for Seoul Games. My uncut, true 80 got me about 20-30 feet off the ground, so the route is approximately 150ft.
content.protection: All the 1s you have. I have small hands and ran it out and still placed five. (Nine would not be unreasonable.) I was happy with two 2s, and four of each from .3 to .75, but those with bigger hands might want more .75s. Bring two ropes or a tag line.
content.location: The farthest right route on the wall.

content.description: This excellent climb has a great variety of crack climbing. Climb a clean thin hand crack to a wide pod. Take a rest and pull through the pod (crux). A good hand crack leads to a finish with small fingers (second crux).
content.protection: BD C4 #0.4-3. Optional 4 for wide pod.

content.description: This shares the same start with Trad Badger. Climb the first 30 feet of Trad Badger and then decode the traverse sequence to the left (crux). After gaining a small ledge, layback a small finger crack to the anchor. Quite fun.
This route stats in a short OW to a tight hands splitter. Super clean!!

This route sports a good variety of hard 5.10 climbing in a rope length. Begin behind a fallen pillar, and take note of the original '88 plaque.

The route starts with a section of 0.75's behind the pillar. Stand on top and start up a section of 0.5's with a few hand pods. Then finish with thin hands.
content.location: About 100ft left of Glad to be Trad.

content.description: An interesting route to say the least. Begin with tight hands and some some chimney style climbing if that is to your fancy. The crack slowly widens to just bigger than fists before a small "ledge". Without giving too much away, keep an eye on the massive block that creates the cave as this feature could come in handy. Finish the route OW style or layback it like a Euro
content.protection: BD (2) #1's, (1) #2, (1) #3, (2) #4's and an optional #5 for up top, anchors
content.location: Continue along the base of the buttress to the right of Trad Badger. Soon you will find a large block leaning against the wall creating a small cave. The base of the route can be found on the right entrance of the cave.

content.description: This route ascends a lichened left-facing corner. Good warm up!
content.protection: Gear - standard rack. Extra tight hands
content.location: On the left side of the wall

content.description: Starts a few feet left of smokin deal. Starts in a L facing corner that is mostly off-fingers with pods. At about half-way, the route traverses R to a L facing corner. Fun stuff!
content.protection: Heavy on off-fingers and thin hands.

content.description:
This route begins near the southwest prow of the crag (~10 yards left of Seoul Games). You must climb up some class 3-4 terrain to reach the base of the crack.

Climb an excellent hand crack as it leans left to right. Near the top, traverse right to a wide crack and then motor to the chains.

The route is currently quite silty and sandy but should clean up well with traffic.
content.protection: Extra BD C4 #2s and maybe a #0.75 or #5 for the top.

climbs.name: A Circle of Quiet
climbs.fa: Bret Ruckman and Marco Cornacchione, FFA Bret and Stuart Ruckman

content.description: Great climb that doesn't see much traffic. Perfect splitter for ~150 feet.
content.protection: Double rack plus a couple extra red camalots.
content.location: Technically on the boundary wall, drive a mile past the park sign and it's on your left.

pathTokens: Trad Wall AKA Green River Buttress
